title: clingo: transitive build dependencies are not ignored

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
If B is a build-only dependency of A, and C is a build-only dependency of B, then C shouldn't be required by A if B already exists. However, with the `clingo` concretizer, C still shows up in the concretization of A even when B is already built.

This is mainly a problem when trying to manually specify an existing build-only dependency for a package, e.g. an already installed external or an out-of-date package whose daughter dependency has changed.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

With clingo:
```console
$ spack spec -I hdf5@1.12: ^cmake/457disr
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   hdf5@1.12:
[+]      ^cmake@3.20.3%apple-clang@12.0.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^openssl@1.1.1k%apple-clang@12.0.5~docs+systemcerts arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]              ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   hdf5@1.12.1%apple-clang@12.0.5+cxx+fortran+hl~ipo~java~mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe+tools api=default build_type=RelWithDebInfo arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]      ^cmake@3.20.3%apple-clang@12.0.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]              ^pkgconf@1.7.4%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^openssl@1.1.1k%apple-clang@12.0.5~docs+systemcerts arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
 -               ^perl@5.34.0%apple-clang@12.0.5+cpanm+shared+threads arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                  ^berkeley-db@18.1.40%apple-clang@12.0.5+cxx~docs+stl patches=b231fcc4d5cff05e5c3a4814f6a5af0e9a966428dc2176540d2c05aff41de522 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                  ^bzip2@1.0.8%apple-clang@12.0.5~debug~pic+shared arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                      ^diffutils@3.7%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                          ^libiconv@1.16%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                  ^gdbm@1.19%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                      ^readline@8.1%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]                  ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
```

With **original** concretizer:
```
$ spack spec -I hdf5@1.12: ^cmake/457disr
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   hdf5@1.12:
[+]      ^cmake@3.20.3%apple-clang@12.0.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^openssl@1.1.1k%apple-clang@12.0.5~docs+systemcerts arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]              ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64

Concretized
--------------------------------
[+]  hdf5@1.12.1%apple-clang@12.0.5+cxx+fortran+hl~ipo~java~mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe+tools api=default build_type=RelWithDebInfo arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]      ^cmake@3.20.3%apple-clang@12.0.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]          ^openssl@1.1.1k%apple-clang@12.0.5~docs+systemcerts arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]              ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
[+]      ^pkgconf@1.7.4%apple-clang@12.0.5 arch=darwin-bigsur-x86_64
```

### Information on your system

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3486-6d22e9cd7b
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** darwin-bigsur-skylake
* **Concretizer:** clingo
* ```
*

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
